app

Class APIHandler

  • java.lang.Object
    • app.APIHandler

  • public final class APIHandler
extends java.lang.Object
    APIHandler is a utility class which makes the communication with the core of the application, the api. It starts the api and communicates with it via commands.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static java.lang.String getApiRoute()
      This method is used to get the full route of the api
      static int getPort()
      This method is used to retrieve the port on which the api listens
      static boolean isReady()
      If the api is ready to receive requests
      static void shutdown()
      This method is used to execute the shutdown command on the api
      static void start()
      This method is used to start the api and wait for it to fully initialize

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Method Detail

      • isReady

        public static boolean isReady()
        If the api is ready to receive requests
        Returns:
        boolean - true - the api is initialized, false - the api is not started or not initialized

      • getPort

        public static int getPort()
        This method is used to retrieve the port on which the api listens
        Returns:
        int - api's port

      • getApiRoute

        public static java.lang.String getApiRoute()
        This method is used to get the full route of the api
        Returns:
        String - api route

      • start

        public static void start()
        This method is used to start the api and wait for it to fully initialize

      • shutdown

        public static void shutdown()
        This method is used to execute the shutdown command on the api
